reviews.review_msg: Your classes were great Prep for med school.  Thanks for making me work so hard.

I don't get how she can still be teaching after so many years of complaints? The online course is a joke. Textbook material is very interesting and straightforward, but her notes online and the exams are INSANELY more difficult than they need to be. Her and Avleen aren't helpful online either. SFU shouldn't allow this course to even exist.

Who said that exams are SUPER easy? It is totally brutal. The material is very difficult, but she makes it more difficult. You need to answer every details of details to get a full mark. Fill-in-the-blank Qs in exams were most brutal things ever! TA is  worst and lazy to respond students' Qs. TA is not helping at all.

SUper easy exams. Hard assignments and very long however. The quizzes were very pressured. But an awesome course! One of my favourites. Work needs to be put in though to get something out of it. Highly recommend.
Terrible Class!!!

This is probably the most difficult course one can take in BPK. The nature of the material is very difficult, there is an unbelievable amount of material that we have to know and it's hard to relate to most of it since the pathway of the tracts is not the most intuitive thing out there. But Dr Anthony is one of the nicest and brightest profs

I am majoring in biology and I have always gotten good marks for both my biology and kin courses. However, no matter how hard I studied for this class, I was always close to failing. For some reason the exams seem pretty straight foward, but when you get back the marks it's always much worse than you expect.
Don't be lazy and take online course thinking you will save time and study more by yourself. It will not happen! You will regret it. This course is HARD, AVOID at all cost.

Absolute GPA dropper! I have  straight As in Biology/ BPK courses so I thought this will be ok for me, but it was my biggest mistake!  The course load is massive and exams/assignments are ridiculously detailed and tough! It was the worst course in BPK upper division and worst course in my 4yr of SFU. DO NOT TAKE. I MEAN IT. DONT DO IT.

She's an excellent prof. She gives you plenty of opportunities to ask questions both in the lab and in lecture. She's also freakishly knowledgable. Her level of understanding of this stuff is very impressive

She's very knowledgable and her notes are great. Everything you need to know is in the notes. Lectures don't help because not only she just reads off the slides but also it's all memorization and there's nothing to explain. Key thing is that you MUST go to the open labs if you want to do well. Ask her as many questions as you can in the lab.

I left her a rough review for KIN 325, then took KIN 326 b/c I switched majors. Different experience. She is very nice and answers any question you ask (unlike many profs).  A little unclear with assignments, but exams are reasonable.  Bottom line: Anatomy is tough. I spent a lot of time going into open lab. You really have to prep for the lab exam

There's no doubt anatomy is a tough subject. I spent a lot of time studying for this. You have to go into this course with a mindset for actually LEARNING rather than memorizing. Going to the open labs really helped me. I enjoyed this class and thought Dr. Anthony gave reasonable exams and she tried to make us laugh with her somewhat corny jokes :)

I'm a hard working student with a GPA of 3.7+ and got slaughtered in this distance class.  I studied hard and was very interested in anatomy before I took the class.  She wants far too much detail for exams and assignments.

i'm surprised at all the nasty comments posted so far...anthony's a great teacher! She really cares about students and even asked me why I skipped a lab. She tries really hard to make us laugh, and her jokes are so lame that we do :)
I have never had to write so much for an assignment to get a measly 2 percent.... She instructs you not to copy the textbook but if you dont you loose marks as she wantes every tiny detail.

Worst proffessor I have ever had. She is unhelpful, blames problems on you "if one person is doing well in the course then everyone can" is her thoughts. Our class average arround 50%. Expected 4-8 pages for assignments worth 1%.Pretty much memorize textbook.Unclear. Does not solve your problem. had to get Dean of Kin involved involded b/c of above

If you can find this course with a different prof, then take it.  Any difficulty you have will not be dealt with as it will be your fault, not hers.  She will look to see if anyone is doing well in the class, and so long as one person is, it will justify her course plan no matter how confusing it is to other students; it's your problem, not hers.

If you can avoid this course as a minor definitley do so. The assignments are ridiculously detailed and the exams are tough also. For the amount of time one puts in there are other courses which will be much more benificial.

She's one tough cookie!  Yes, its a mandatory course for majors... its a tough course, but very useful.  STUDY STUDY STUDY MEMORIZE the hell out of everything (word for word).  Dont get the text.  The cadavre was cool.

An unfortunate experience, to say the least. While she clearly knows her material, her lecturing skills need fast improvement. Cannot answer questions gracefully - will focus on making you feel like you asked a stupid question rather than actually answering the question. Mandatory course for KIN majors...
her notes are way too scattered to follow. she reads about 1000 words/min. her lab exam was intense but lecture was fair. tough class, but you have to do it.

I hate Anthony.  She does know her stuff, but is so incredibly picky on exams.  and for what?  We aren't anatomy buffs... Just take what you think you got and take off 10% immediately.   She wont even answer questions in class unless she asks you something. I mean, Im not asking cuz it feels good... stupid. HATE I SAY, HATE.

for the assignments...you need to pretty much write an essay for each question in order to get it right. there's always something missing. the TA was so anal and wanted an explanation for everything. questions are vague and they don't tell you how much they're worth. definately lots of memorization involved, which means a lot of time.

NEVER take anatomy by distance (I realize that was the first mistake) but if we had had some sort of guidance as to what she was expecting of us there may have been a grade higher than an A- in a group of 30! She expects WAY too much.  This class shouldn't even be offered.  T
A lot of stuff to memorize, especially for the lab component. Be sure to go in for open lab. Exams were fair, but you need to know everything.
amazing prof, dedicated and knows her**** - you memorize and keep on top of the material -you're golden. - if you don't, don't complain.

memorize memorize and memorize!!!!!!!!!!
 if you can memorize everything, you will get A
 but you are not good at memorizing, dont even think about taking this course.....
She just can't shut up during the lab quizes! She seems nice enough, but then she'll screw you on exams.  There's a ton of material in this class.
way too much info to absorb...

WICKED teacher... she was very helpful and clear about what she wanted for exams. Forget the textbook and make sure u know ur notes inside out. Alotta material but the course is interesting. oh yeah and make sure u spend alotta time in the lab - HELPED ME
